site_name: Development At Wanstead Park Road Allotments And Land On The South West Side Of
description: Temporary change of land use for a construction compound to support fencing upgrades/works at Gas Transmission Station.  (summary)
decision_conditions:
1.	(Time Limit): The development hereby permitted shall be begun no later than the  expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

2.	(Temporary Permission): The use of the site, and the approved compound, buildings, security kiosks, skips, security fencing/gates, hard surfacing, and any widening of the access road as shown in drawing No. 21847-MMD-0186-XX-PLN-M-0006 shall be removed and the land re-instated to its former condition as scrubland and an allotment plot, 18 months after the commencement of the temporary change of use (other than in regard to tree removal approved herein and in regard to subsequent landscaping approved under condition 9, below). 

Reason: The approved use is a temporary permission and is not considered suitable on a permanent basis.

3.	(Strictly in accordance with plans): The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following plans and documents:  

•	421847-MMD-0186-XX-DET-M-0005 Rev P2
•	421847-MMD-0186-XX-PLN-M-0005 Rev P2
•	421847-MMD-0186-XX-PLN-M-0004 Rev P2
•	421847-MMD-0186-XX-PLN-M-0006 Rev P2
•	Archaeological Desk Based Assessment for Works at Redbridge London (Ref 002, dated July 2022)
•	Flood Risk Assessment and Surface Water Drainage Strategy (Ref AEG0502_IG1_07, rev 1.2, dated 20th September 2022) and Appendices
•	Heritage Statement for works at Redbridge, (Ref 003, dated June 2022) and appendices
•	Planning Supporting Statement (Ref 001, dated June 2022)
•	Wanstead Allotments Stage 1 and 2 Arboricultural Impact Assessment Report (Ref 2483584 Rev 1, dated 20th July 2022)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
   
4.	(Pre felling Bat survey): Before the development hereby permitted commences (including site clearance, and enabling works), a pre-felling survey and crevice inspection of the trees and tree groups identified to be felled within the approved Arboricultural Impact Assessment prepared by RSK biocensus (Ref. Wanstead Allotments Rev 1) shall be carried out. Written evidence that this has been done shall be produced and submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to the commencement of development. Where this leads to a need to obtain licences for works affecting protected species, evidence of such licences shall be provided to the Local Planning Authority prior to the identified commencement of development

Reason:  To comply with Policy G6 in the London Plan, and Policy LP39 of the Local Plan.

5.	(Constrution Envrionmental Management Plan): Before the development hereby permitted commences (including site clearance, and enabling works), the applicant will take the necessary mitigation and enhancement measures cited in chapter 4. "Evaluation and Reccomendations" of the Ecological Appraisal Report (March 2022, Written evidence that this has been carried out shall be produced and submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to the commencement of development.

The approved details are to be implemented and maintained as approved. 

Any clearance of scrub and trees within the site shall be timed to avoid the bird nesting season (March to August). 

Prior to the start of works on site the contractor should receive a ‘toolbox’ talk/training to describe the ecological features and species present, their legal protection and responsibilities towards them and what to do if wildlife is encountered. Excessive noise from prolonged generator use, ground contamination and light pollution from artificial external lighting, must also be documented, with mitigation measures submitted to limit their impact to wildlife and the surrounding area.

Reason:  To comply with Policy G6 in the London Plan, and Policy LP39 of the Local Plan.

6.	(Construction and Logistics Plan): Before the development hereby permitted commences, a scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority describing the means by which construction activity at the site and construction traffic to and from the site shall be controlled.  The scheme shall include measures for:

1)	construction traffic routes;
2)	construction traffic washing;
3)	public highway cleaning;
4)	dust suppression;
5)	noise suppression;
6)	hours of work;
7)	construction waste disposal.

The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed in accordance with the approved scheme.

Reason: In order to comply with Policy LP22 of the Council’s Local Plan and to ensure that the construction of the development at this site is undertaken in a manner which minimises its effect on the local environment.


7.	(NRMM): All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA’s supplementary planning guidance “Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition” dated July 2014 (SPG), or subsequent guidance.  Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority.  The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.

Reason: In order to ensure that the construction of the devleopment is undertaken in a manner which minimises its’ effect on the local envrionment and to comply with Policies LP24, and LP26 of the Council’s Local Plan. 

8.	(Landscaping): Notwithstanding the indicative details shown on the plans hereby approved, before occupation of the development, a scheme of soft landscaping shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority and shall include the following:

a)	Planting plan 
b)	Written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with trees, plants and grass); and 
c)	Schedules of plants and trees, setting out the species, sizes, numbers/densities and soil depths. 
d)	Woodland management works of the surrounding trees and scrubland surrounding the site setting out details of the compensatory habitats, and a planting plan that would be created post operations

The scheme shall also include a programme setting out how the plan will be put into practice including measures for protecting plants and trees both during and after development has finished. 

The new planting shall be carried out in accordance with BS 8545 (2014) ‘Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape’ in the first planting and/or seeding season following the first occupation of the residential buildings hereby permitted or the substantial completion of the development, whichever is the sooner and shall comply with the requirements specified in BS 3936 (1992) 'Specification of Nursery Stock Part 1 Trees and Shrubs', and in BS 4428 (1989) 'Recommendations for General Landscape Operations'. None of the new trees, plants or shrubs planted shall be lopped or topped within a period of five years from the completion of the development. Any trees, plants or shrubs, which, within a period of five years from the completion of the development die, are removed, or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season, in accordance with the approved scheme. The approved landscaping scheme shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved scheme and be maintained thereafter for the lifetime of the development. 

Reason: To enhance biodiversity, and to accord with Policies LP26, LP38, and LP39 of the Council’s Local Plan and the London Borough of Redbridge Trees and Landscaping SPD (June 2006).

9.	(Protection of Trees): During construction of the development hereby permitted, no trees not already consented for, shall not be lopped or felled without the written consent of the local planning authority.

During construction of the development hereby permitted, any trees within or near to the site shall be protected in accordance with the requirements of BS 5837 (2012) 'Trees in Relation to Design, Demolition and Construction'. The protection measures shall be implemented prior to any below ground works, and shall be retained for the entire period of the duration of any work at the site, in connection with the development hereby permitted.

Reason: In order to maintain the existing vegetation at the site, which makes an important contribution to the character of the area, and to accord with Policies LP26 and LP38 of the Council’s Local Plan.

10.	(Flood Risk 1): Prior to commencement of above ground works, a maintenance plan detailing the schedule of maintanence responsibilities for the permeable surfacing and water butts and the responsible owner shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details as approved shall be implemented at the site and permanently retained  for the duration of the use unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In order to ensure that on-site rainwater will not be discharging to the main surface water drain, to reduce the potential for rainwater soakage and worsen potential surface flooding events and to ensure the development complies with Policies LP26 and LP34 of the Council’s Local Plan.

11.	(Flood Risk 2): Prior to commencement of above ground works, confirmation of appropriate infiltration rates should be provided shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details as approved shall be implemented at the site and permanently retained  for the duration of the use, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In order to ensure that on-site rainwater will not be discharging to the main surface water drain, to reduce the potential for rainwater soakage and worsen potential surface flooding events and to ensure the development complies with Policies LP26 and LP34 of the Council’s Local Plan.

12.	(External Lighting): Prior to commencement of above ground works, details of the external lighting for the buildings, access and compound shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Any lights must use the lowest possible lux/wattage warm LEDs (towards the amber spectrum), with well cowled luminaires

The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter for the duration of the proposed use

Reason: To ensure compliance with the requirements of policies LP26 and LP39 of the Councils Local Plan.

18.	(Cycle Parking):  Prior to commencment of above ground works, details of  proposed secure and sheltered cycle parking in order to provide nine cycle spaces, (six long stay and three short stay) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The facilities as approved shall then be retained at the site thereafter in accordance with the approved drawings for the duration of the proposed use.

Reason: In order to ensure the development complies with the terms of the application and with Policy LP23 of the Council’s Local Plan.
